definitions.definition: (of a place) protected from bad weather.
examples: the plants need a shady, sheltered spot in the garden

definitions.definition: protected from difficulties or unpleasant realities.
examples: she led a sheltered life until her mother and father went through a bitter divorce

definitions.definition: protect or shield from something harmful, especially bad weather.
examples: the hut sheltered him from the cold wind
synonyms: insulate More"the hut sheltered him from the wind"protected
covered; shady; cozy "a sheltered stretch of water"

definitions.definition: find refuge or take cover from bad weather or danger.
examples: people were sheltering under store canopies and trees
synonyms: take cover; informalhole up "the anchorage where the convoy sheltered"

definitions.definition: prevent (someone) from having to do or face something difficult or unpleasant.
examples: secluded, cloistered, isolated, protected, withdrawn, sequestered, reclusive; Moreprivileged, secure, safe, quiet "she led a sheltered life"Moreprivileged, secure, safe, quiet she led a sheltered life
only your rental income can be sheltered
